qas.question: What is the Tibetan name for the area?
Which ancient people were mentioned in the first written reference to Bod "Tibet"?
What area did Bod originally refer to?
What is the Egyptian name for Tibetan land?
Who made the first reference to Bod "Tibet?"
When was the first written reference to Tibet by the Egyptian people made?
When was Periplus of the Geographia Sea written?

context: The Tibetan name for their land, <a0_0><b3_0>Bod<a0_0/> བོད<b3_0/>་, means "Tibet" or "Tibetan Plateau", although it originally meant the <a2_0>central region around Lhasa<a2_0/>, now known in Tibetan as Ü. The Standard Tibetan pronunciation of Bod, [pʰøʔ˨˧˨], is transcribed Bhö in Tournadre Phonetic Transcription, Bö in the THL Simplified Phonetic Transcription and Poi in Tibetan pinyin. Some scholars believe the first written reference to Bod "Tibet" was the <b4_0>ancient <a1_0>Bautai<a1_0/> people<b4_0/> recorded in the Egyptian Greek works Periplus of the Erythraean Sea (<b5_0><b6_0>1st century CE<b6_0/><b5_0/>) and Geographia (Ptolemy, 2nd century CE), itself from the Sanskrit form Bhauṭṭa of the Indian geographical tradition.
